result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly J. Moderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $76.20 paid directly to the Clerk of Court's Office prior to sentencing.  The 10% surcharge in the amount of $7.62 still due and owing - same repayment conditions apply as noted below for the Costs.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelly J. Moderson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court finds contempt-45 days in WC Jail-stayed. Must post 100.00 to achieve release from jail then 50.00/month starting Nov 1, 2015.

Case called @ 1:21 p.m. Defendant Kelly J. Moderson in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Zouski - obligation was due in June 2015 with no payments being made. Statement by DE.  The court finds contempt. Court orders 45 days WCJ - Stayed - Purge conditions: Initial payment of $100 then $50 monthly starting November 1, 2015 until paid in full.

Request from Mr. Moderson to be seen on Sept 25, 2015 for his FTP contempt hearing. Letter arrived in our office on 09-28-2015 from WC jail-Response from Judge that we will see him on Sept 30, 2015 with bond hearings

10:57 am case called. Defendant Kelly J. Moderson in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: No Contest.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. No statement by defendant. Court sentences the defenant to: $76.20 restitutuion, which has been paid. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.

Prior: 1633 Weiland Lane, Appleton, WI 54914
Attempted - Not Known - Unable to Forward

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Kelly J. Moderson in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE intends to make payments toward restitution and wishes to speak with the DA regarding possible resolution. The court allows the parties an opportunity to speak about the matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.  Defendant is prohibited from issuing any checks for payment.

Case Called @ 2:15 PM: Defendant Kelly J. Moderson in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def referred to SPD for eligibility.  NGP received and entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 02:35 pm.
